channel.title: Catalog Model on OSCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Catalog Model on OSCAL

item.title: Catalog JSON Model Map
item.description: + catalog: [1]{… } - catalog: [1]{ uuid: uuid [1], + metadata: [1]{… }, - metadata: [1]{ title: markup-line [1], published: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], last-modified: dateTime-with-timezone [1], version: string [1], oscal-version: string [1], + revision-history: [0 to ∞]{… }, - revision-history: [0 to ∞]{ title: markup-line [0 or 1], published: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], last-modified: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], version: string [0 or 1],

item.title: Catalog JSON Schema Reference
item.description: Schema download oscal_catalog_schema.json Schema version 1.0.0-milestone3 Short name oscal-catalog The OSCAL Control Catalog format can be used to describe a collection of security controls and related control enhancements, along with contextualizing documentation and metadata. The root of the Control Catalog format is catalog. Switch to XML addr-line Name Address line Description A single line of an address. A string property. This object appears as a property on: address.

item.title: Catalog XML Model Map
item.description: + <catalog uuid="uuid"> [1]… </catalog> - <catalog uuid="uuid"> [1] + <metadata> [1]… </metadata> - <metadata> [1] <title>markup-line</title> [1] <published>dateTime-with-timezone</published> [0 or 1] <last-modified>dateTime-with-timezone</last-modified> [1] <version>string</version> [1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version> [1] + <revision-history>[0 or 1]… </revision-history> - <revision-history>[0 or 1] + <revision> [1 to ∞]… </revision> - <revision> [1 to ∞] <title>markup-line</title> [0 or 1] <published>dateTime-with-timezone</published> [0 or 1] <last-modified>dateTime-with-timezone</last-modified> [0 or 1] <version>string</version> [0 or 1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version> [0 or 1]

item.title: Catalog XML Schema Reference
item.description: Schema download oscal_catalog_schema.xsd Schema version 1.0.0-milestone3 Short name oscal-catalog XML namespace http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal/1.0 The OSCAL Control Catalog format can be used to describe a collection of security controls and related control enhancements, along with contextualizing documentation and metadata. The root of the Control Catalog format is catalog. Switch to JSON addr-line Name Address line Description A single line of an address. An element (string) This element appears inside: address.

item.title: Catalog Examples
item.description: The following OSCAL Catalog model examples are provided. NIST SP 800-53 Note: Full versions of the NIST SP 800-53 revision 4 catalog are available in OSCAL XML, JSON, and YAML formats in the OSCAL GitHub repository. These examples also include assessment and objective content from NIST SP 800-53A revision 4. Here is a non-normative, partial illustration showing how control AC1 from NIST SP 800-53 rev 4 can be rendered in OSCAL Catalog XML format with a <control> element.
